Optional adaExceptions

adaExceptions?: { virtualized?: boolean }

Inherited from PartialMultiSelectDropdownProps.adaExceptions

  • Defined in node_modules/@jpmuitk/dropdown/Dropdown.d.ts:53

Object that houses ADA-related props.

property

{bool} virtualized Set to true to boost browser performance for long lists by rendering only the items currently scrolled into view (plus overscan items). JSX: adaExceptions={{virtualized:true}} For better ADA support, omit (or set to false).

Type declaration

  • Optional virtualized?: boolean

Optional density

density?: Density

Inherited from PartialMultiSelectDropdownProps.density

  • Defined in node_modules/@jpmuitk/dropdown/MultiSelectDropdown.d.ts:52

The density of a component affects the style of the layout. A high density component uses minimal sizing and spacing to convey the intended UI design. Conversely, a low density component, maximizes the use of space and size to convey the UI Design.

Optional disabled

disabled?: boolean

Optional displayedRowCount

displayedRowCount?: number

Inherited from PartialMultiSelectDropdownProps.displayedRowCount

  • Defined in node_modules/@jpmuitk/dropdown/Dropdown.d.ts:88

Number of rows to display at any time. Defaults to source.length or rowCount. Scrollbar will be displayed if the displayedRowCount is less then the rowCount / source.length.

Methods

Optional filter

  • filter(items: Item[], inputValue: string): Item[]

  • Inherited from PartialMultiSelectDropdownProps.filter

    • Defined in node_modules/@jpmuitk/dropdown/MultiSelectDropdown.d.ts:64

    Provide a custom filter function for a static source. Set to null to provide no filtering and to display all source items.

    Parameters

    • items: Item[]

      The items to filter

    • inputValue: string

      The component's input value

    Returns Item[]

Optional getA11yStatusMessage

  • getA11yStatusMessage(options: MultiA11yStatusMessageOptions<any>): any

  • Inherited from PartialMultiSelectDropdownProps.getA11yStatusMessage

    • Defined in node_modules/@jpmuitk/dropdown/MultiSelectDropdown.d.ts:88
    external
    • downshift This function is passed as props to a Status component nested within and allows you to create your own assertive ARIA statuses. A default getA11yStatusMessage function is provided that will check resultCount and return "No results." or if there are results but no item is highlighted, "resultCount results are available, use up and down arrow keys to navigate." If an item is highlighted it will run itemToString(highlightedItem) and display the value of the highlightedItem.

    Parameters

    • options: MultiA11yStatusMessageOptions<any>

    Returns any

Optional onChange

  • onChange(selectedItems: Item[], stateAndHelpers: ControllerStateAndHelpers<Item>): void

  • Inherited from PartialMultiSelectDropdownProps.onChange

    • Defined in node_modules/@jpmuitk/dropdown/MultiSelectDropdown.d.ts:139
    external
    • downshift Called when the user selects an item and the selected item has changed. Called with the items that are selected and the new state of downshift. (see onStateChange for more info on stateAndHelpers).

    Parameters

    • selectedItems: Item[]

      The items that are selected

    • stateAndHelpers: ControllerStateAndHelpers<Item>

      Helpers provided by downshift. See https://github.com/paypal/downshift#children-function

    Returns void

Optional onSelect

  • onSelect(selectedItems: Item[], stateAndHelpers: ControllerStateAndHelpers<Item>): void

  • Inherited from PartialMultiSelectDropdownProps.onSelect

    • Defined in node_modules/@jpmuitk/dropdown/MultiSelectDropdown.d.ts:153
    external
    • downshift Called when the user selects an item, regardless of the previous selected item. Called with the items that are selected and the new state of downshift. (see onStateChange for more info on stateAndHelpers).

    Parameters

    • selectedItems: Item[]

      The items that are selected

    • stateAndHelpers: ControllerStateAndHelpers<Item>

      Helpers provided by downshift. See https://github.com/paypal/downshift#children-function

    Returns void
